dc:title: On Pilgrimage - May 1980
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Finds it hard to write about her sister Della who died--"my closest friend and confidante." Recalls growing up in Chicago together and their reading, conversations, and walks. Notes their differences over birth control--Della had worked for Margaret Sanger who Dorothy once interviewed.
